titleStmt.title: Batrachomyomachia: or: The wonderfull and bloudy battell betweene frogs and mice The occasion of their falling out: their preparation, munition, and resolution for the warres: the severall combats of every person of worth, with many other memorable accidents. Interlaced with divers pithy and morall sentences, no lesse pleasant to be read, then profitable to be observed. Paraphrastically done into English heroycall verse, by William Fowldes, late one of the cursitors of his Majesties high Court of Chancery.
Battle of the frogs and mice. English.

Batrachomyomachia: or: The wonderfull and bloudy battell betweene frogs and mice The occasion of their falling out: their preparation, munition, and resolution for the warres: the severall combats of every person of worth, with many other memorable accidents. Interlaced with divers pithy and morall sentences, no lesse pleasant to be read, then profitable to be observed. Paraphrastically done into English heroycall verse, by William Fowldes, late one of the cursitors of his Majesties high Court of Chancery.
Battle of the frogs and mice. English.
titleStmt.author: Fowldes, William.
Homer, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by T[homas]. H[arper]. for Lawrence Chapman, and are to be sold at his shop in Holborne, at Chancery Lane end,

notesStmt.note: Attributed in antiquity to Homer, but probably of a much later date.
First word of title in Greek characters.
Reproduction of original in the British Library, London, England.
